senses.de: To include or add something as a part of something else.
senses.ex: She incorporated the changes that needed to be made into the final design.

Tips.title: Not Always Physical
Tips.description: Incorporate doesn't only mean adding physical items; it can involve ideas or qualities too.
Tips.example: The team incorporated her suggestions for improving their strategy.

Tips.title: Building Harmony
Tips.description: Incorporating often means adding new elements in a way that they blend in harmoniously.
Tips.example: The artist incorporated modern and traditional styles in his painting.

Tips.title: Subtle Change
Tips.description: Use incorporate to indicate that the change is subtle and doesn't overshadow the whole.
Tips.example: The designer incorporated delicate lace details into the dress.

senses.de: To form a legal corporation; to turn a company into a corporation.
senses.ex: After years of success, they decided to incorporate the business.

Tips.title: Legal Process
Tips.description: When incorporating a company, it's a formal legal process that involves paperwork and often lawyers.
Tips.example: They hired an attorney to help incorporate their technology startup.

Tips.title: More than a Name
Tips.description: Incorporation isn't just about the company name; it offers legal protections and structure.
Tips.example: Incorporating their business allowed them to protect personal assets from liability.

senses.de: To mix or blend into something, so that it becomes a part of it.
senses.ex: Slowly incorporate the eggs into the mixture.

Tips.title: Cooking Context
Tips.description: In cooking, incorporate means blending ingredients until they're not distinguishable.
Tips.example: Incorporate the flour gently to keep the batter light and fluffy.

Tips.title: Gradual Addition
Tips.description: Incorporating often involves slowly adding to avoid drastic changes or mistakes.
Tips.example: She incorporated the feedback gradually so as not to overwhelm the original project.

Assimilate.wordDefinition:
Assimilate means to fully integrate and become a part of something larger, while incorporate means to bring something into a larger entity or system.

Assimilate is applicable when talking about individuals or groups who are adopting a new culture or way of living. For example, if someone moves to a new country and starts to learn the language and customs, they are assimilating into that culture.

Blend.wordDefinition:
Blend means to mix two or more things together to create a uniform consistency. For example, when making a smoothie, you blend the fruits and yogurt to make a smooth and consistent texture.

Blend is used when you want to make two or more things into a consistent texture or uniform mixture, while incorporate is used when you want to include one thing into another to create a new whole.

Combine.wordDefinition:
Combine means to blend or join two or more things together to make a whole. For example, if you combine flour, sugar, and eggs, you can make a cake.

The main difference between these two words is that combine means to mix things together, while incorporate means to add something new into something existing.

Embody.wordDefinition:
Embody means to be a tangible or visible representation of something abstract, while incorporate means to include something as a part of a larger whole.

- A superhero may embody the qualities of courage and selflessness.

Embody is applicable when talking about abstract concepts, such as values or traits, and how they are exemplified in a person or thing.

Encompass.wordDefinition: Encompass means to surround or include something entirely. It is applicable when something completely covers or contains something else.

Fuse.wordDefinition:
Fuse means to blend or mix together two or more things into one. It is applicable when you want to combine two or more elements to create something new that has common characteristics of the original elements.

For example, when you mix two different colors to create a new color, you're fusing the two colors together.

In simpler terms, fuse means to mix or combine two things, while incorporate means to include one thing within another.

Include.wordDefinition:
Include means to have something as a part or component of a larger whole. For example, a shopping list might include milk, bread, and eggs.

Include is used when something is being added to a list or group, while incorporate is used when something is being blended or combined together.

Integrate.wordDefinition:
Both incorporate and integrate refer to combining different things into a single entity, but there is a subtle difference.

Integrate suggests bringing together different elements to create a harmonious or cohesive whole. It means blending different things together so that they work together smoothly.

For example, a sports team may integrate new players into their existing roster, or a company may integrate different software systems to streamline its processes.

Incorporate is used when you want to create something new by combining things, while integrate is used when you want to blend different things together to work more efficiently or effectively.

Merge.wordDefinition:
Incorporate and merge are both related to combining two entities, but there is a slight difference.

When two companies merge, they combine to form a new company. The original two companies no longer exist and their assets and liabilities are combined.

In simpler terms, merging is when two companies combine to create a new one, while incorporating is when a company creates a new legal entity to operate under.

Unite.wordDefinition:
Unite means to bring together multiple things or people to form a single entity or group. For example, two companies might choose to unite and become one larger company.

The main difference is that incorporate means to add something to something else while keeping the original structure, while unite means to bring two or more things together to create something new.

quotes.Text: Ultimately, I think there's this umbrella term of jazz, and what's cool about not just what's happening with my music but this general sense of what's happening with this generation of musicians, is it's a very broad term, and we can incorporate all types of music, and we can be influenced and inspired by all kinds of sounds.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Gretchen Parlato

quotes.Text: One of the reasons I love acting is because I'm so interested in other people's lives, and I often incorporate things I hear or observe into my work. I've become a bit of a 'person addict,' and so I like brushing up against lots of different characters.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Jason Alexander

quotes.Text: I think as you become a more open person and let others in, just in your regular life, you'll be surprised by how much you find and how you can then incorporate that into the work you put online.
quotes.Name: Eugene Lee Yang

quotes.Text: I try to find a reason to laugh each day. Somehow, if you can incorporate laughter into your day, every day, it really helps. It's the little things in life that make me happy.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Faith Hill

quotes.Text: When it comes to song creation, I throw in my ideas and have it discussed with the producer. The song gets its own characteristic as new ideas are incorporated.
quotes.Title: South Korean Musician
quotes.Name: Hyuna

quotes.Text: I meet people every single day who have heard the music and incorporated it into their lives. I feel like I have a tribe all around the world.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Jason Mraz

quotes.Text: I've trained in wing chung, jeet kune do, I've indulged in many arts that people would not have thought I have trained in and incorporated.
quotes.Title: American Mixed Martial Artist
quotes.Name: Frank Mir

quotes.Text: The employees who share innovative ideas may also be the folks who have some hidden talents that would help incorporate their suggestions.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Harvey Mackay

quotes.Text: I did learn a lot from 'Project Runway,' things I could incorporate into my own life.
quotes.Title: American Model
quotes.Name: Angela Lindvall

quotes.Text: Jazz has always been a melting pot of influences and I plan to incorporate them all.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Esperanza Spalding
